greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of binary words of length n that have no pair of adjacent 1's and have k subwords 0000 (n>=0; k=0 for n=0,1,2; 0<=k<=n-3 for n>=3).
comment: Sum of entries in row n is the Fibonacci number A000045(n+2).
example: T(5,1)=2 because we have 00001 and 10000; T(7,2)=3 because we have 0000010, 0100000, and 1000001.
maple: G := (1+z)*(1+z-t*z+z^2-t*z^2+z^3-t*z^3)/(1-t*z-z^2+t*z^3-z^3+t*z^4-z^4): Gser := simplify(series(G, z = 0, 18)): for n from 0 to 15 do P[n] := sort(coeff(Gser, z, n)) end do: 1; 2; 3; for n from 3 to 15 do seq(coeff(P[n], t, k), k = 0 .. n-3) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 15 2010
